com.slightlyloony.blog.storage

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.slightlyloony.blog.storage.Storage

  • public class Storage
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides access to the storage system (disk) for the blog.
    Author:
    Tom Dilatush tom@dilatush.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Storage(java.lang.String _rootPath)
      Creates a new instance of this class that will store data in the directory specified by the given objectsRoot path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Storage

        public Storage(java.lang.String _rootPath)
        Creates a new instance of this class that will store data in the directory specified by the given objectsRoot path.
        Parameters:
        _rootPath - The path to the content objectsRoot directory

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public BlogObject read(BlogID _id,
                       BlogObjectType _type,
                       BlogObjectAccessRequirements _accessRequirements,
                       ContentCompressionState _compressionState)
                throws StorageException
        Reads the blog object with the given IntegerDatum, type, and access requirements. The IntegerDatum and type are required. The access requirements are optional; if missing (null) then this is an internal request. All requests for external access must include access requirements, as this is used as part of the file name. If an error occurs, an invalid blog object is returned.
        Parameters:
        _id - the blog object IntegerDatum for the desired object
        _type - the blog object type for the desired object
        _accessRequirements - the optional access requirements (for external requests only)
        _compressionState - the compression state of this object
        Returns:
        the blog object read
        Throws:
        StorageException - on any problem

      • create

        public BlogObject create(BlogObject _object)
                  throws StorageException
        Creates a new file to persist the given blog object. This object's blog IntegerDatum should have been created just before this method is invoked, to minimize the possibility that the server could go down with the object not persisted.
        Parameters:
        _object - the object to be persisted
        Returns:
        the blog object representing the shiny new object
        Throws:
        StorageException - on any problem

      • update

        public BlogObject update(BlogObject _object)
                  throws StorageException
        Updates an existing blog object with the new content given blog object. The returned blog object contains a stream for the updated blog object.
        Parameters:
        _object - the blog object with updated content
        Returns:
        the blog object representing the shiny new object
        Throws:
        StorageException - on any problem

      • getObjects

        public java.io.File getObjects()
